p:
Nonadecane (24.72%) and heneicosane (19.32%) were the main constituents of the essential oil, in agreement with the study of Verma et al.
17 . Nonadecane (16.79–40.5%) was reported as the second dominant compound and heneicosane (7–14%) as the fourth dominant compound in central Iran
7, 21 . The environmental and ecological factors in central Iran appear to be similar to those of India and are one of the influential factors in increasing the composition of aliphatic hydrocarbons, which reduces the aroma of rose essential oil.
